page.title: 08OLD HALL AT TATTON
page.content: THE {OLD HALL} DATES BACK TO MEDIEVAL AND TUDOR TIMES.BUT WITH LATER ALTERATIONS AND ADDITIONS. THE {GREAT HALL} HAS A CARVED, QUATREFOIL TIMBERED ROOF AND WITH PAINTED HANGINGS AND AN OPEN WOOD FIRE IT IS NOT DIFFICULT TO IMAGINE LIFE IN 1475 WHEN SIR GEOFFREY MASSEY LIVED THERE. A TEN MINUTE SLIDE AND SOUND SHOW AND A CONDUCTED TOUR ROUND THE 7 ROOMS HELPS TO RECREATE THE PAST. {A BEDROOM}IN 1700'S STYLE HAS BEEN FURNISHED TO SHOW HOW{SIR JOHN {EGERTON}MIGHT HAVE LIVED BEFORE THE NEW MANSION WAS BUILT. { THE GAMEKEEPER'S QUARTERS}SHOW A WAY OF LIFE AT THE TURN OF THIS CENTURY WITH THE TOOLS OF HIS TRADE. NEARBY A 16TH CENTURY {CRUCK BARN} HAS BEEN RECONSTRUCTED WHERE VISITORS ARE INVITED TO TRY THRESHING AND LOOK AT THE COLLECTION OF AGRICULTURAL TOOLS
